project_1.name: Network Intrusion Detection System (NIDS)
project_1.brief: Developed an AI-driven Network Intrusion Detection System (NIDS) combining CNN + LSTM models for real-time detection of cyberattacks. Achieved 96% accuracy in classifying traffic, with a Flask API + interactive dashboard for deployment and simulation.
project_1.medium: This project addressed the limitations of traditional IDS by integrating AI/ML for detecting both known and unknown network intrusions. Using datasets like NSL-KDD and CICIDS, the system applied preprocessing, feature selection, and deep learning models (CNN-LSTM) to capture spatial + temporal attack patterns. A Flask-based API enabled real-time traffic monitoring, classification, and visualization. The system achieved 96% accuracy, handling up to 1M records with <100ms latency. It classified multiple attack types, with strong performance on DoS but weaker recall on rare attacks (R2L, U2R).

detailed.datasets: NSL-KDD, KDD Cup 1999, CICIDS (benign + malicious traffic)
detailed.preprocessing: Categorical encoding, feature scaling, cleaning missing values, reshaping for CNN-LSTM
detailed.model_architecture: Hybrid CNN-LSTM for spatial + temporal pattern detection. Hyperparameter tuning + ensemble methods used to optimize accuracy
detailed.deployment: Flask-based API, dashboard for simulating attacks + viewing real-time detections

performance_metrics.rare_attacks: Lower recall for rare R2L/U2R attacks due to class imbalance

project_2.name: AI-Based Indian Road Pothole Detection
project_2.brief: Developed a deep learning-based pothole detection system tailored for Indian road conditions. Built a custom dataset (2,000+ images, 20+ region-specific keywords) and used a YOLOv8 + CNN + Transformer hybrid model, achieving 92% accuracy compared to 60% with foreign datasets.
project_2.medium: Most existing pothole detection systems are trained on foreign datasets and perform poorly on Indian roads due to shadows, water patches, and irregular textures. To address this, we created a custom Indian dataset using web scraping and data augmentation, capturing realistic conditions like uneven surfaces, patches, and varying lighting. The proposed hybrid model combined YOLOv8 for real-time detection, CNN for spatial feature extraction, and Transformers for contextual awareness. Evaluated against foreign-trained models, our approach achieved 92% accuracy, significantly reducing false positives. This highlights the importance of localized datasets and hybrid deep learning architectures in infrastructure monitoring.

detailed.dataset_creation: 2,000+ Indian road images collected via web scraping (Google, Bing, Flickr) using 20+ location-specific keywords (e.g., 'Bangalore damaged road,' 'Mumbai road cracks'). Preprocessed (resized, normalized) with augmentations (rotation, brightness, flips)

model_design.cnn_layers: Extract local textures and pothole patterns
model_design.transformer_module: Attention-based global context to distinguish potholes from shadows, water, and surface variations

detailed.training_setup: Google Colab GPU, batch size 32, 50 epochs, Adam optimizer, YOLOv8 loss (object + classification + localization)

results.hybrid_model: 92% accuracy, robust to lighting/noise, reduced false positives
results.iou_scores: High IoU scores for bounding box localization
results.multiple_detection: Successfully detected multiple potholes under diverse real-world conditions

strengths: Multiple pothole detection in single frame
future_work: Extending to other infrastructure issues (cracks, erosion)

project_3.name: Hate Speech Detection Using Machine Learning (ICON 2024 - 3rd Place)
project_3.brief: Developed a multilingual hate speech and fake narrative detection system for Hindi-English code-mixed social media text. Used TF-IDF, Random Forest, and SMOTE to address class imbalance. Secured 3rd place in Task A of ICON 2024 and published a research paper.
project_3.medium: This project tackled the challenge of detecting hate speech and fake narratives in Hindi-English code-mixed social media text. The system combined text preprocessing, TF-IDF vectorization, Random Forest classifiers, and SMOTE to handle class imbalance. It achieved strong performance with an accuracy of ~78% for fake news detection and 77%+ F1 score for hate speech detection, ranking 3rd in Task A of the ICON 2024 Faux-Hate Shared Task. The framework also classified target (Individual, Organization, Religion) and severity (Low, Medium, High) of hate speech.

detailed.final_model: Random Forest (Hate-FakeNet) with feature engineering + SMOTE

results.task_b: Target + Severity: 13th rank with advanced ensemble (Hate-FakeNet-Plus)

detailed.contribution: Robust multilingual hate speech detection with ethical focus on responsible deployment
detailed.publication: Research paper published in ICON 2024 proceedings

project_4.name: LAW GPT 2.0 - Advanced AI Legal Assistant
project_4.brief: Developing an AI-powered legal assistant for Indian law, enabling real-time Q&A across 158K+ legal records. The system ingests web-scraped data from LawRato, Kanoon, and multiple legal sources to provide accurate and comprehensive information, deployed for scalable access.
project_4.medium: LAW GPT 2.0 is a production-ready, multilingual AI legal research assistant specifically designed for Indian law with advanced RAG pipeline and 163,504+ legal records. Built with Python (FastAPI backend) and React frontend, it uses Google Gemini AI for intelligent legal reasoning. The system supports 12 Indian languages, provides semantic search through legal databases, and offers confidence-based responses with legal citations. Deployed on Railway + Firebase with real-time streaming responses and mobile-responsive interface.
